title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3. ENABLING ENVIRONMENT Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: By end 2021, state technical services, civil society organisation, implemeneting partners, as well as targeted communities, have the knowledge and resources to coordinate, plan, budget and legislate towards extending interventions to promote quality and sustainability of the drinking water, sanitation and hygiene supply services, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Wash â€“ General, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: By the end of 2022, women and children in the 11 target regions, especially the most vulnerable, make greater and sustainable use of safe drinking water and sanitation services and adopt good hygiene practices to prevent diseases.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2021, state technical services, civil society organisation, implemeneting partners, as well as targeted communities, havethe knowledge and resources to coordinate, plan, budget and legislate towards extending interventions to promote quality andsustainability of the drinking water, sanitation and hygiene supply services

description.narrative: The main achievement;in 2021;was the integration of WASH in the National Adaptation Plan (NAP) and the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC), key national documents for climate change, which positioned WASH as the third among eight priority sectors to be considered for climate change mitigation and adaptation.;;The development of the national strategy for WASH in healthcare facilities began;with the assessment of infection prevention and control (IPC) in healthcare facilities, both in rural and urban settings.;;The assessment;carried out in;74 health care facilities revealed gaps to be considered in the development of the strategy.;;; | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:23/01/2022
